channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Flexible Error Mitigation of Quantum Processes with Data Augmentation Empowered Neural Model
item.description: Neural networks have shown their effectiveness in various tasks in the realm of quantum computing.

item.title: Finding Common Ground: Annotating and Predicting Common Ground in Spoken Conversations
item.description: An important part of cognitive state is the common ground, which is the content the speaker believes, and the speaker believes the audience believes, and so on.

item.title: Better with Less: A Data-Active Perspective on Pre-Training Graph Neural Networks
item.description: The proposed pre-training pipeline is called the data-active graph pre-training (APT) framework, and is composed of a graph selector and a pre-training model.

item.title: Exploring Unified Perspective For Fast Shapley Value Estimation
item.description: Shapley values have emerged as a widely accepted and trustworthy tool, grounded in theoretical axioms, for addressing challenges posed by black-box models like deep neural networks.

item.title: COPAL-ID: Indonesian Language Reasoning with Local Culture and Nuances
item.description: We present publicly available COPAL-ID, a novel Indonesian language common sense reasoning dataset.

item.title: IndoToD: A Multi-Domain Indonesian Benchmark For End-to-End Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems
item.description: Task-oriented dialogue (ToD) systems have been mostly created for high-resource languages, such as English and Chinese.

item.title: Gaussian Mixture Solvers for Diffusion Models
item.description: Our investigation suggests that this is because the Gaussian assumption in the reverse transition kernel is frequently violated (even in the case of simple mixture data) given a limited number of discretization steps.

item.title: Collaborative Large Language Model for Recommender Systems
item.description: Recently, there is a growing interest in developing next-generation recommender systems (RSs) based on pretrained large language models (LLMs), fully utilizing their encoded knowledge and reasoning ability.

item.title: Cheating Depth: Enhancing 3D Surface Anomaly Detection via Depth Simulation
item.description: (ii) We tackle the lack of diverse industrial depth datasets by introducing a simulation process for learning informative depth features in the depth encoder.

item.title: Tailoring Mixup to Data using Kernel Warping functions
item.description: Data augmentation is an essential building block for learning efficient deep learning models.

item.title: Can Language Models Be Tricked by Language Illusions? Easier with Syntax, Harder with Semantics
item.description: We found that probabilities represented by LMs were more likely to align with human judgments of being "tricked" by the NPI illusion which examines a structural dependency, compared to the comparative and the depth-charge illusions which require sophisticated semantic understanding.

item.title: DP-Mix: Mixup-based Data Augmentation for Differentially Private Learning
item.description: Data augmentation techniques, such as simple image transformations and combinations, are highly effective at improving the generalization of computer vision models, especially when training data is limited.

item.title: Bi-Preference Learning Heterogeneous Hypergraph Networks for Session-based Recommendation
item.description: Secondly, price preference and interest preference are interdependent and collectively determine user choice, necessitating that we jointly consider both price and interest preference for intent modeling.

item.title: Multi-Operational Mathematical Derivations in Latent Space
item.description: To this end, we introduce different multi-operational representation paradigms, modelling mathematical operations as explicit geometric transformations.

item.title: Combating Bilateral Edge Noise for Robust Link Prediction
item.description: To address this dilemma, we propose an information-theory-guided principle, Robust Graph Information Bottleneck (RGIB), to extract reliable supervision signals and avoid representation collapse.

item.title: Video2Music: Suitable Music Generation from Videos using an Affective Multimodal Transformer model
item.description: These distinct features are then employed as guiding input to our music generation model.

item.title: Detecting Deepfakes Without Seeing Any
item.description: We therefore introduce the concept of "fact checking", adapted from fake news detection, for detecting zero-day deepfake attacks.

item.title: ATHENA: Mathematical Reasoning with Thought Expansion
item.description: Solving math word problems depends on how to articulate the problems, the lens through which models view human linguistic expressions.

item.title: Concatenated Masked Autoencoders as Spatial-Temporal Learner
item.description: Learning representations from videos requires understanding continuous motion and visual correspondences between frames.

item.title: Cross-Modal Information-Guided Network using Contrastive Learning for Point Cloud Registration
item.description: Specifically, we first incorporate the projected images from the point clouds and fuse the cross-modal features using the attention mechanism.

item.title: Invariant-Feature Subspace Recovery: A New Class of Provable Domain Generalization Algorithms
item.description: First, in the binary classification setup of Rosenfeld et al. (2021), we show that our first algorithm, ISR-Mean, can identify the subspace spanned by invariant features from the first-order moments of the class-conditional distributions, and achieve provable domain generalization with $d_s+1$ training environments.

item.title: Better Together: Enhancing Generative Knowledge Graph Completion with Language Models and Neighborhood Information
item.description: In this study, we propose to include node neighborhoods as additional information to improve KGC methods based on language models.

item.title: AeroPath: An airway segmentation benchmark dataset with challenging pathology
item.description: In this study, we introduce a new public benchmark dataset (AeroPath), consisting of 27 CT images from patients with pathologies ranging from emphysema to large tumors, with corresponding trachea and bronchi annotations.

item.title: Learning A Multi-Task Transformer Via Unified And Customized Instruction Tuning For Chest Radiograph Interpretation
item.description: We first compose a multi-task training dataset comprising 13. 4 million instruction and ground-truth pairs (with approximately one million radiographs) for the customized tuning, involving both image- and pixel-level tasks.

item.title: Multi-view Relation Learning for Cross-domain Few-shot Hyperspectral Image Classification
item.description: In addition, it adopts a transformer based cross-attention learning module to learn the set-level sample relations and acquire the attentions from query samples to support samples.

item.title: Distance-Based Propagation for Efficient Knowledge Graph Reasoning
item.description: A new class of methods have been proposed to tackle this problem by aggregating path information.

item.title: Attention based Dual-Branch Complex Feature Fusion Network for Hyperspectral Image Classification
item.description: Experimental evidence show that SE block improves the models overall accuracy by almost 1\%.

item.title: Distilling Out-of-Distribution Robustness from Vision-Language Foundation Models
item.description: We propose a conceptually simple and lightweight framework for improving the robustness of vision models through the combination of knowledge distillation and data augmentation.

item.title: Dynamic Multimodal Information Bottleneck for Multimodality Classification
item.description: Specifically, our information bottleneck module serves to filter out the task-irrelevant information and noises in the fused feature, and we further introduce a sufficiency loss to prevent dropping of task-relevant information, thus explicitly preserving the sufficiency of prediction information in the distilled feature.

item.title: Vision-Language Interpreter for Robot Task Planning
item.description: The aim is to generate a problem description (PD), a machine-readable file used by the planners to find a plan.

item.title: Sim2Real Bilevel Adaptation for Object Surface Classification using Vision-Based Tactile Sensors
item.description: Our evaluation is conducted on a dataset of tactile images obtained from a set of ten 3D printed YCB objects.

item.title: Collaboration and Transition: Distilling Item Transitions into Multi-Query Self-Attention for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: Second, we develop a transition-aware embedding distillation module that distills global item-to-item transition patterns into item embeddings, which enables the model to memorize and leverage transitional signals and serves as a calibrator for collaborative signals.

item.title: Generating QM1B with PySCF$_{\text{IPU}}$
item.description: Similar benefits are yet to be unlocked for quantum chemistry, where the potential of deep learning is constrained by comparatively small datasets with 100k to 20M training examples.

item.title: Diffusion Models for Reinforcement Learning: A Survey
item.description: Diffusion models have emerged as a prominent class of generative models, surpassing previous methods regarding sample quality and training stability.

item.title: Improving Robustness via Tilted Exponential Layer: A Communication-Theoretic Perspective
item.description: State-of-the-art techniques for enhancing robustness of deep networks mostly rely on empirical risk minimization with suitable data augmentation.

item.title: Time Series Anomaly Detection using Diffusion-based Models
item.description: Our models outperform the baselines on synthetic datasets and are competitive on real-world datasets, illustrating the potential of diffusion-based methods for AD in multivariate time series.

item.title: Task-Agnostic Low-Rank Adapters for Unseen English Dialects
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are trained on corpora disproportionally weighted in favor of Standard American English.

item.title: H-NeXt: The next step towards roto-translation invariant networks
item.description: The widespread popularity of equivariant networks underscores the significance of parameter efficient models and effective use of training data.

item.title: VCISR: Blind Single Image Super-Resolution with Video Compression Synthetic Data
item.description: In this work, we for the first time, present a video compression-based degradation model to synthesize low-resolution image data in the blind SISR task.

item.title: A Survey of Large Language Models for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Recently, large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated abilities including understanding context, logical reasoning, and generating answers.

item.title: AiluRus: A Scalable ViT Framework for Dense Prediction
item.description: Specifically, at the intermediate layer of the ViT, we utilize a spatial-aware density-based clustering algorithm to select representative tokens from the token sequence.

item.title: Implicit Chain of Thought Reasoning via Knowledge Distillation
item.description: In this work, we explore an alternative reasoning approach: instead of explicitly producing the chain of thought reasoning steps, we use the language model's internal hidden states to perform implicit reasoning.

item.title: Offline Imitation from Observation via Primal Wasserstein State Occupancy Matching
item.description: To address this problem, we propose Primal Wasserstein DICE (PW-DICE), which minimizes the primal Wasserstein distance between the expert and learner state occupancies with a pessimistic regularizer and leverages a contrastively learned distance as the underlying metric for the Wasserstein distance.

item.title: Resilient Multiple Choice Learning: A learned scoring scheme with application to audio scene analysis
item.description: Multiple Choice Learning is a simple framework to tackle multimodal density estimation, using the Winner-Takes-All (WTA) loss for a set of hypotheses.

item.title: Effective Human-AI Teams via Learned Natural Language Rules and Onboarding
item.description: Our novel region discovery algorithm finds local regions in the data as neighborhoods in an embedding space that corrects the human prior.

item.title: A Simple Solution for Offline Imitation from Observations and Examples with Possibly Incomplete Trajectories
item.description: Offline imitation from observations aims to solve MDPs where only task-specific expert states and task-agnostic non-expert state-action pairs are available.

item.title: Lightweight super resolution network for point cloud geometry compression
item.description: This paper presents an approach for compressing point cloud geometry by leveraging a lightweight super-resolution network.

item.title: Evaluation Measures of Individual Item Fairness for Recommender Systems: A Critical Study
item.description: To our knowledge, this is the first critical comparison of individual item fairness measures in recommender systems.

item.title: SatBird: Bird Species Distribution Modeling with Remote Sensing and Citizen Science Data
item.description: The wide availability of remote sensing data and the growing adoption of citizen science tools to collect species observations data at low cost offer an opportunity for improving biodiversity monitoring and enabling the modelling of complex ecosystems.

item.title: Optimal Transport-Guided Conditional Score-Based Diffusion Models
item.description: Conditional score-based diffusion model (SBDM) is for conditional generation of target data with paired data as condition, and has achieved great success in image translation.
